definition: to keep up appearances/to put up a front
to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: He bought the saloon car to keep up appearances.
sentences.chinese: 他买这辆高级轿车主要是为了撑门面。

sentences.english: So when they really want to impress someone, they may roll out a foreigner.
sentences.chinese: 因此当一家公司想要撑门面，往往秀出外国人。

definition: to keep up appearances/to put up a front
see 裝點門面|装点门面[zhuang1 dian3 men2 mian4]
lit. to decorate the front of one's store (idiom)/fig. to embellish (one's CV, etc)/to keep up appearances/to put up a front
not presentable/shoddy and too embarrassing to show
to serve as a stopgap/to make up a shortfall in the number of people
to make up the number (i.e. to fill places up to a given number)/to serve as stopgap
ugly/shameful/to ridicule
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: not presentable/not fit to be seen in company
to do (sb) proud/to be a credit to (one's school etc)/to make oneself look good/to build up one's image
wretched/poverty-stricken/unpresentable (for clothing, gifts etc)
to allow sb to save face/to defer to
acceptable/passable/justifiable/(of a course of action) to make sense
shop front/facade/CL:間|间[jian1]/prestige
outer surface/outside/honor/reputation/face (as in "losing face")/self-respect/feelings/(medicinal) powder
to help/to assist financially
